summary: This is an automated email notification from the US Department of Justice informing a sender that their message containing possible sensitive Personally Identifiable Information (PII) could not be delivered to an external recipient because it was not properly encrypted. The notification references a subject line regarding subpoenas.

events.title: DOJ Memo on Safeguarding PII
events.description: The Department of Justice issued a memorandum titled 'Safeguarding Personally Identifiable Information' establishing policies for handling sensitive information.

events.title: Failed Email Transmission
events.description: An email from the US Department of Justice with the subject 'RE: Subpoenas' was blocked from delivery to an external recipient because it contained possible PII and was not encrypted.

keyFacts: The US Department of Justice has a strict policy, established in a 2015 memo, requiring encryption for emails containing Personally Identifiable Information (PII) sent to external users.
An email with the subject 'RE: Subpoenas' was blocked on August 16, 2019, for failing to meet these encryption requirements, indicating it contained possible sensitive PII.
The notification explicitly prohibits sending PII to or from personal email addresses (e.g., Gmail, Yahoo).
The document is a system-generated failure notice, not the content of the original blocked message about subpoenas.
